articles.title: Mother's Day Marked in DPR of Korea
articles.content:
Mother's Day Marked in DPR of Korea 
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- All the families of the DPRK marked Mother's Day. Sons and daughters congratulated their mothers.
					 Mothers across the country visited statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang and in different parts of the country to lay floral baskets and bouquets and pay tribute to them. 
					
					 They also visited the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, her statues in Kim Jong Suk County and Hoeryong City.
					
					 Exemplary nurses, teachers and employees of the baby homes and orphanages of the country who were on tour of Pyongyang expressed thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea for sending them chima and jogori materials, etc.
					
					 Colorful art performances took place in Pyongyang and all provinces, cities and counties across the country to congratulate the mothers. 
					
					 The Samjiyon Band of Mansudae Art Troupe gave a performance at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre and the National Symphony Orchestra gave a concert at the Moranbong Theatre. 
					
					 The revolutionary drama "A Letter from a Daughter" was staged at the National Theatre. 
					
					 Pyongyangites enjoyed circus at the Pyongyang Circus Theater and diverse films at the Kaeson Cinema, Tongdaewon Cinema, etc. 
					
					 Similar art performances took place across the country including Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province and Kanggye City, Jagang Province. 
					
					 Women singing and laughing could be seen in the parks and pleasure grounds across the country. 
					
					 Flower stands were crowded with the working people, young people and children.
					
					 Greeting cards were sent to mothers by their children from posts defending the country, socialist construction sites and universities and schools. 
					
					 Public catering establishments across the country kindly served mothers greeting Mother's Day.

articles.title: DPRK Women Players' Successes at World Weightlifting Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Women Players' Successes at World Weightlifting Championship
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman weightlifter Kim Un Ju bagged two gold medals, winning the title in the women's 75kg category event of the 2014 World Weightlifting Championship. 
					 On Saturday she placed first in jerk by lifting 157kg and in total points. 
					
					 Meanwhile, another DPRK player Rim Jong Sim grabbed a silver medal in jerk of the same category.

articles.title: Papers Editorially Observe Mother's Day
articles.content:
Papers Editorially Observe Mother's Day
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Newspapers here today dedicate editorials to the Mother's Day.
					 Rodong Sinmun says the mothers in the DPRK are significantly marking the day amid the profound care and blessings of the party and the state as they are deeply respected and loved by all other people.
					
					 This is a manifestation of the Workers' Party of Korea and people's profound gratitude and respect for the best mothers in the world who have rendered great services to the country and nation with high revolutionary spirit, ardent patriotism and deep love for the children, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 The mothers in the DPRK are the excellent educators who brought up a large contingent of successors to the revolution and revolutionaries and patriots who have devoted themselves to the revolutionary cause of the party.
					
					 They are the beautiful human beings totally dedicated to the society and the collective.
					
					 The world knows no such women as the mothers of the DPRK who let their sons and daughters fight life-and-death battles and no instance of the mothers who sent their dear eight sons and daughters or six sons and daughters to posts for defending the country and those who feel proud of their children who laid down their lives to be true to their revolutionary principles, left all alone on an isolated island. 
					
					 They deserve praises from people just for bringing up their children and leading them to take the road of revolution and helping their husbands to be loyal to their revolutionary duties.
					
					 But not content with this, they are devoting themselves to the revolutionary cause of the party and its cause of building a rich and powerful country.
					
					 The history of the Korean people's heroic struggle in which they made the unprecedented Arduous March and have stepped up the dynamic advance for building a thriving nation records the precious feats performed by the mothers. 
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon all mothers of the DPRK to work hard for the rosy future of prosperous Songun Korea under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S. Missile Sale to S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S. Missile Sale to S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. decided to sell 136 PAC-3s to south Korea. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This deal self-exposes the reason why the U.S. extended the transfer of the right to the wartime operation control (OPECON).
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 It is the sinister intention of the U.S. ruling quarters that south Korea should bolster up its armed forces to cope with the "threat" from the DPRK and buy weapons from it to this end. 
					
					 Munitions industries of the U.S. are now shouting for joy at windfall to be expected from the extension of transfer of the OPECON to south Korea. 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the U.S. munitions industries such as Lockheed Martin and Radian will go busy with the production of weaponry, pointing fingers of scorn at the south Korean puppet authorities faithfully serving the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. goal is to see Koreans fight each other. "Merchants of death" of the U.S. conceived an arms sale designed to kill many birds with one stone. This is a criminal act of sparking a fratricidal war in Korea. This arms deal between the aggressors and traitors is lashing all Koreans into fury.
					
					 All facts go to prove the validity of the DPRK's measures to bolster up its nuclear deterrence. 
					
					 The above-said arms deal only compels the DPRK to further bolster up its nuclear deterrence.

articles.title: Lifting of May 24 Measure Demanded in South Korea
articles.content:
Lifting of "May 24 Measure" Demanded in South Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Economic bodies engaged in the inter-Korean economic cooperation held a press conference near Kwanghwamun in Seoul on Nov. 13  in demand of the lifting of the "May 24 measure", sanctions against the north,  according to the south Korean KBS.
					 They deplored they had lived a painful life since the "May 24 measure" took effect.
					
					 They demanded the regime lift the measure immediately and resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 They pinned a great hope on the 2nd round of the south-north high-level contact but their hope was dashed by the leaflet scattering operations of bodies of defectors from the north, they noted.
					
					 They urged the authorities to check the leaflet scattering operations and punish the main culprits.

articles.title: Enlargement of Light Tower on Aegi Hill Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Enlargement of Light Tower on Aegi Hill Denounced in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Religious organizations in south Korea including the Missionary Solidarity Council of Christian Society and the Pastors' Council for Realizing Justice and Peace held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 14 in denunciation of the south Korean puppet group's plan to escalate the anti-DPRK psychological warfare by enlarging the light tower on Aegi Hill, according to the south Korean CBS. 
					 The tower on Aegi Hill in Kagum-ri, Hasong-myon in Kimpho City of Kyonggi Province has served as a means for anti-DPRK psychological warfare of the south Korean puppet authorities. 
					
					 That is why south Koreans and all other Koreans strongly demanded the dismantlement of the tower escalating north-south confrontation and tension. 
					
					 However, the present chief executive of south Korea got angry over the removal of the tower without her knowledge while the coteries of the "Saenuri Party" and Kimpho City Administration authorities called for enlarging the light tower and zealously stepping up its project. 
					
					 In this regard, the religious organizations at the press conference voiced vehement protest against the move to rebuild it and strongly demanded a halt to it.

articles.title: S. Korean Court's Decision Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Court's Decision Protested
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in a statement issued on Nov. 13 denounced the unfair decision of the supreme court in south Korea on the Ssangyong Motors's action.
					 The statement accused the supreme court of ruling that the Motors' indiscriminate dismissal of workers was legal.
					
					   This was little short of imposing death sentence upon the workers, it held.
					
					       The action taken by the Motors left dozens of workers and their families dead.
					
					    Holding the present regime wholly accountable for the crisis, the statement demanded it stop pushing the workers to a cliff.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries in the period between October 30 and November 8 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a Korean book and photo exhibition, round-table talks and film shows in Mexico, Germany and Nigeria.
					
					 Displayed at the venue of the exhibition were photos dealing with the revolutionary exploits performed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display there were works of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books and photos introducing the successes achieved by the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Participants in the film shows watched Korean films including "Arms of Korea" and "Munsu Water Park".
					
					 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 He always lives in the hearts of not only the Korean people but progressive mankind as he performed exploits before the Korean revolution and cause of global independence.
					
					 We are very pleased that the WPK and Korean people are bringing about new miracles and innovations in their drive for building a thriving socialist nation, united close around Kim Jong Un, to fulfill the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will achieve greater successes in carrying out the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of socialism under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany highly praised Kim Jong Il for always showing deep trust and loving care for the young people and successfully solving the issue of successors to the revolution.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Iran
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Iran
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- An Iranian committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Tehran on Nov. 10.
					 The chairman of the Al Hadi Islam Propaganda Organization of Iran was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 It decided to hold political and cultural events including remembrance meeting, photo exhibition and film show on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- An Indian committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in New Delhi on Nov. 10.
					 The general secretary of the Indian National Congress Party was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to publish works of Kim Jong Il and hold such political and cultural events as seminar on exploits, round-table talks and film show on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Brazil
 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A Brazilian committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in San Paulo on Nov. 11.
					 Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to publish works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and hold political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting, seminar on exploits, photo exhibition and film show.
